Package application

Class Date

java.lang.Object
application.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Date>
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Date>
A class that hold data for a date with methods to gain more information. Also provides utility to check for valid dates(accounting for leap years and other parameters)
Author:
Abdullah Salem, Gent Blaku

      Parameters:
      bookYear - to be checked
      Returns:
      true if it is a leapyear, false if not

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      A method that checks if the date object has a valid date/ A valid date is one that is both possible, not in the future, and not in the distant past.
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid, false if it is not

    • isOlderThan

      public boolean isOlderThan​(Date other)
      A method that checks if the date of the object is chronologically before the date of the other object.
      Parameters:
      other - is the object of the date class to be measure against
      Returns:
      true if this object is older, false if it is younger

      Returns:
      true if this object is younger, false if it is older

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Date date)
      Overidding the compareTo method from the comparable interface
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Date>
      Returns:
      0 if this date is equal to the other date, -1 if this date is before the other date, 1 if this date is after the other date
